savedBooks.title: Frankenstein or The Modern Prometheus
savedBooks.author: Mary Shelley
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the shadowed halls of a university in Ingolstadt, Victor Frankenstein, a brilliant and ambitious student, becomes consumed by a daring quest to unlock the secrets of life itself, driven by a mix of scientific curiosity and personal tragedy. Working in isolation, he constructs a being from scavenged parts, bringing it to life in a moment of triumph that quickly turns to dread as he confronts the reality of his creation. The creature, towering and misunderstood, wanders into a world that shuns it, forcing Victor to grapple with the consequences of his actions as their paths begin to intertwine. Shelley’s haunting narrative unfolds across icy landscapes and quiet villages, weaving a tale of creation, responsibility, and the search for belonging in a gothic framework that lingers with unease.

savedBooks.title: The Man Who Was Thursday
savedBooks.author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
savedBooks.sypnosis: Gabriel Syme, a poet with a penchant for order, steps into the shadowy underworld of London as a secret policeman, tasked with infiltrating a council of anarchists who name themselves after days of the week. Appointed ‘Thursday,’ he meets the group’s towering leader, ‘Sunday,’ a figure whose jovial menace sets Syme on edge, and a band of conspirators whose motives remain cloaked in mystery. As he moves through smoky pubs and bustling streets, Syme finds himself drawn into a chase that blurs the lines between chaos and purpose, surrounded by allies and enigmas alike. Chesterton’s tale spins a web of suspense and philosophical wonder, inviting readers into a surreal journey through a city alive with secrets.

savedBooks.title: The Secret Adversary
savedBooks.author: Agatha Christie
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the lively chaos of post-World War I London, Tommy Beresford and Tuppence Cowley, two spirited friends down on their luck, decide to form ‘The Young Adventurers, Ltd.,’ offering their wits for hire in a city buzzing with change. Their first job comes quickly: a search for a missing woman tied to a secret document lost when the Lusitania sank, pulling them into a shadowy game of intrigue. Pursued by a mysterious figure known only as ‘Mr. Brown,’ they dodge danger through bustling streets and quiet tea rooms, meeting a cast of allies and foes—from a nervous American to a sharp-witted heiress. Christie’s early thriller crackles with energy and light romance, setting the stage for a duo whose pluck and banter shine amid a web of secrets.

currentlyReading.author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

Their first job comes quickly: a search for a missing woman tied to a secret document lost when the Lusitania sank, pulling them into a shadowy game of intrigue. Pursued by a mysterious figure known only as ‘Mr. Brown,’ they dodge danger through bustling streets and quiet tea rooms, meeting a cast of allies and foes—from a nervous American to a sharp-witted heiress. Christie’s early thriller crackles with energy and light romance, setting the stage for a duo whose pluck and banter shine amid a web of secrets.

savedBooks.title: Pride and Prejudice
savedBooks.author: Jane Austen
savedBooks.sypnosis: In the rolling countryside of Regency England, Elizabeth Bennet, a sharp-witted young woman, lives with her four sisters and fretful mother, who is eager to secure them all advantageous marriages due to their modest circumstances. The arrival of the charming Mr. Bingley and his reserved friend Mr. Darcy at nearby Netherfield Park stirs the small community, setting off a flurry of balls, visits, and whispered speculations. Elizabeth finds herself at odds with Darcy’s aloof demeanor, sparking a lively clash of personalities that draws them into a web of misunderstandings and unspoken tensions. Alongside her family’s quirks—her father’s dry humor, her mother’s matchmaking zeal, and her sisters’ varied pursuits—the story unfolds with a cast of colorful figures like the pompous Mr. Collins and the dashing yet dubious Mr. Wickham, all navigating the delicate dance of love, pride, and social expectation in Austen’s witty exploration of human connection.

savedBooks.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
savedBooks.author: Lewis Carroll
savedBooks.sypnosis: On a lazy summer afternoon, curious Alice spots a White Rabbit in a waistcoat, hurrying along with a pocket watch and muttering about being late, prompting her to follow him down a peculiar rabbit hole. She tumbles into Wonderland, a strange and whimsical land where she encounters a host of eccentric characters: a grinning Cheshire Cat, a Mad Hatter hosting an endless tea party, and a hot-tempered Queen of Hearts fond of croquet and commands. As Alice navigates this topsy-turvy world—shrinking and growing with mysterious potions and cakes—she faces absurd situations, from debating a philosophical Caterpillar to joining a game with flamingos as mallets. Carroll’s fantastical tale brims with playful riddles and surreal encounters, inviting readers into a dreamlike realm where the rules of reality bend and a young girl’s curiosity leads her through a maze of wonder and oddity.

savedBooks.title: Vingt mille lieues sous les mers
savedBooks.author: Jules Verne
savedBooks.sypnosis: Professor Pierre Aronnax, a French marine scholar, sets sail to investigate a mysterious ‘narwhal’ plaguing the seas, joined by his steadfast servant Conseil and the rugged harpooner Ned Land, only to find themselves aboard the Nautilus, a marvel of a submarine. Its commander, the enigmatic Captain Nemo, reveals a world beneath the waves, from coral gardens to sunken wrecks, all seen through the vessel’s glass ports as they glide through ocean depths. Aronnax marvels at the science and secrecy of Nemo’s domain, while Ned chafes at their confinement, their journey weaving through currents and wonders that defy the surface world. Verne’s vision dives into a realm of discovery and tension, blending awe with the pull of freedom.

savedBooks.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
savedBooks.author: Oscar Wilde
savedBooks.sypnosis: Dorian Gray, a youthful beauty in Victorian London, captivates the artist Basil Hallward, who pours his soul into a portrait that glows with life, while the worldly Lord Henry Wotton whispers ideas of pleasure and youth into Dorian’s ear. Drawn into the glittering salons and dim theaters of the city, Dorian begins to chase a life of sensation, surrounded by admirers and the trappings of wealth, yet tethered to the painting that holds a secret he can’t ignore. As he moves through a society of strict codes and hidden vices, the contrast between his outward charm and inner choices begins to cast a shadow. Wilde’s gothic narrative glimmers with wit and unease, sketching a young man’s journey into a world where beauty and truth pull in opposite directions.
